author: China Insights
description:
The Yu Menglong case is escalating! This is not just an actor’s fall from a building, but a storm tugging at red power, state-capital money flows, and the entertainment industry’s darkest underbelly. From EE-Media’s contract prison to the true identity of the “red princeling” Xin Qi—each layer we dig reveals a darker one. On Beijing’s streets, fans still mourn with iced Coke and sunflowers; online, keywords are deleted and photos vanish. Who fears the truth? Who manipulates fate? Don’t miss the next drop—subscribe and enable the bell.
Welcome to China Insights — your window into the real China, beyond the veil.
With sharp analysis and a touch of dry humor, we dive into the social unrest, economic crises, censorship, faith suppression, and human rights challenges shaping China today.
We spotlight authentic Chinese culture, deliver timely and uncensored news, break down key economic trends, and explore shifting social dynamics — all while exposing the Chinese Communist Party’s complex r
title: Ten Years, Nine Deaths: A Blood Trail Toward Power?

author: China Insights
description:
This storm only grows fiercer the more it’s suppressed. The Yu Menglong case has taken another earth-shaking turn! A British medium went live and revealed a “six-person ritual,” saying it was “not an accident,” and the details astonishingly match a circulating audio recording! Meanwhile, Fan Shiqi’s concert was canceled at the last minute, blowing up the whole internet—some say it’s a “health issue,” others say it’s a “conscience issue.” Stranger still, the character for “fish” is blocked, “umbrella” is banned, and even fishing streamers are mistakenly banned! Who is covering this up? Behind this “ban-Fish storm” lies the darkest face of China’s entertainment industry. Don’t miss the next drop—subscribe and enable the bell.
Welcome to China Insights — your window into the real China, beyond the veil.
With sharp analysis and a touch of dry humor, we dive into the social unrest, economic crises, censorship, faith suppression, and human rights challenges shaping China today.

title: Yu Menglong Case Twist? Fan Shiqi Cancels Show; Medium vs. Audio, “Fish” Ban Spirals

author: China Insights
description:
A seemingly ordinary “thankfulness” set off a tsunami of public opinion. Chinese-Canadian Hollywood actor Simu Liu returned to Beijing for Mid-Autumn Festival, and one line—“that in China I can still live a relatively normal life”—sent the comments section into meltdown. Some said he was doing PR; others said he was being sarcastic. While the whole internet is still shaken by the Yu Menglong case, this sentence looks more like a mirror—reflecting the absurd reality of China’s entertainment industry: here, “living normally” has become a luxury, and “daring to tell the truth” has become a risk. From Hollywood to scenic-spot stages, from Shang-Chi to the “re-employment” of mainland and Hong Kong stars, a chill of the times is spreading across the Chinese-language entertainment world. Don’t miss the next drop—subscribe and enable the bell.
Welcome to China Insights — your window into the real China, beyond the veil.
With sharp analysis and a touch of dry humor, we dive into the social unr
title: From Yu Menglong to Simu Liu: In Showbiz, ‘Normal’ Has a Price

author: China Insights
description:
It turns out the truth is trickling out bit by bit. He didn’t “leave”—it was taken from him. The “forensic report” is filled with external injuries: severe head trauma, fractured ribs, bruises all over—yet the official conclusion is just four characters: “accidental fall.”
On Mid-Autumn Festival, his friend Julaiti released the song Are You Listening? It wasn’t merely remembrance; it was testimony and accusation. “The final message stopped at: Wait for me.” That wasn’t a song—it was a cry for help.
On overseas social platforms, many fans also composed songs to speak up for him with music—one bright moon, one melody, and countless longings turned into silent tears. Don’t miss the next drop—subscribe and enable the bell.
Welcome to China Insights — your window into the real China, beyond the veil.

title: Are You Listening? A Song Turns Into Testimony
